intro: Trichoscypha letestui, commonly known as the African sand apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, yellow fruit that is edible and contains a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
